contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox person | name = Jan Theuninck | image = Jan Theuninck.JPG | image_size = | alt = Jan Theuninck | caption = Jan Theuninck | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1954|6|7}} | birth_place = [[Zonnebeke]], [[Belgium]] | death_date = <!-- {{death date and age|df=yes|YYYY|MM|DD|YYYY|MM|DD}} --> | death_place = | nationality = {{BEL}} | other_names = | known_for = | occupation = painter, poet }}{{Use dmy dates|date=September 2010}} '''Jan Theuninck''' (born 7 June 1954), is a Belgian [[Painting|painter]] and [[poet]]. Although born in [[Zonnebeke]], [[Belgium]], and a native speaker of [[Dutch language|Dutch]], he writes in [[French language|French]] and occasionally [[English language|English]]. His painting is abstract, falling somewhere between [[minimalism]] and monochrome [[expressionism]]. As a painter, he has been influenced by [[Ellsworth Kelly]] and [[Joan MirÃ³]]. His work in both media is guided by his social and political convictions, dealing with topics such as [[colonialism]] old and new, mass and society, and [[pacifism]]. ==External links== * [http://www.boekgrrls.nl/BgDiversen/Onderwerpen/gedichten_over_schilderijen.htm ''Holocaust'' by Jan Theuninck on Boekgrrls] *[http://www.exposweb.net/Visual_Art/Jan_Theuninck/JTImageGallery/album0.html Theuninck's work extensively on the Expose'd website] *[http://www.trinity.wa.edu.au/plduffyrc/subjects/english/poetry/jan.htm Great War poetry] {{Wikiquote}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Theuninck, Jan | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = painter, poet | DATE OF BIRTH = 7 June 1954 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Zonnebeke]], [[Belgium]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Theuninck, Jan}} [[Category:Belgian painters]] [[Category:Belgian poets in French]] [[Category:Flemish writers]] [[Category:1954 births]] [[Category:Living people]] {{Belgium-painter-stub}}
